info.title: KeyVaultClient
info.description: The key vault client performs cryptographic key operations and vault operations against the Key Vault service.

parameters.name: vaultBaseUrl
parameters.description: The vault name, for example https://myvault.vault.azure.net.

post.summary: Unwraps a symmetric key using the specified key that was initially used for wrapping that key.
post.description: The UNWRAP operation supports decryption of a symmetric key using the target key encryption key. This operation is the reverse of the WRAP operation. The UNWRAP operation applies to asymmetric and symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since it uses the private portion of the key.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the key operation.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

enabled.description: Determines whether the object is enabled.

Attributes.description: The object attributes managed by the KeyVault service.

kty.description: Supported JsonWebKey key types (kty) for Elliptic Curve, RSA, HSM, Octet. Kty is usually set to RSA

q.description: RSA secret prime, with p < q.

key_hsm.description: HSM Token, used with 'Bring Your Own Key'.

recoveryLevel.description: Reflects the deletion recovery level currently in effect for keys in the current vault. If it contains 'Purgeable' the key can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the key, at the end of the retention interval.

KeyAttributes.description: The attributes of a key managed by the key vault service.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

managed.description: True if the key's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

KeyBundle.description: A KeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its attributes.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

managed.description: True if the key's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

KeyItem.description: The key item containing key metadata.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted key.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the key is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the key was deleted, in UTC

DeletedKeyBundle.description: A DeletedKeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its Attributes and deletion info

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted key.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the key is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the key was deleted, in UTC

DeletedKeyItem.description: The deleted key item containing the deleted key metadata and information about deletion.

contentType.description: The content type of the secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

kid.description: If this is a secret backing a KV certificate, then this field specifies the corresponding key backing the KV certificate.

managed.description: True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a secret backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

SecretBundle.description: A secret consisting of a value, id and its attributes.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

contentType.description: Type of the secret value such as a password.

managed.description: True if the secret's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

SecretItem.description: The secret item containing secret metadata.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

DeletedSecretBundle.description: A Deleted Secret consisting of its previous id, attributes and its tags, as well as information on when it will be purged.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted secret.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the secret is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the secret was deleted, in UTC

DeletedSecretItem.description: The deleted secret item containing metadata about the deleted secret.

recoveryLevel.description: Reflects the deletion recovery level currently in effect for secrets in the current vault. If it contains 'Purgeable', the secret can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the secret, at the end of the retention interval.

value.description: The backup blob associated with a secret bundle.

recoveryLevel.description: Reflects the deletion recovery level currently in effect for certificates in the current vault. If it contains 'Purgeable', the certificate can be permanently deleted by a privileged user; otherwise, only the system can purge the certificate, at the end of the retention interval.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

CertificateItem.description: The certificate item containing certificate metadata.

CertificateIssuerItem.description: The certificate issuer item containing certificate issuer metadata.

contentType.description: The content type of the secret.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs

CertificateBundle.description: A certificate bundle consists of a certificate (X509) plus its attributes.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted certificate.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the certificate is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the certificate was deleted, in UTC

DeletedCertificateBundle.description: A Deleted Certificate consisting of its previous id, attributes and its tags, as well as information on when it will be purged.

recoveryId.description: The url of the recovery object, used to identify and recover the deleted certificate.

scheduledPurgeDate.description: The time when the certificate is scheduled to be purged, in UTC

deletedDate.description: The time when the certificate was deleted, in UTC

DeletedCertificateItem.description: The deleted certificate item containing metadata about the deleted certificate.

issuer.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

csr.description: The certificate signing request (CSR) that is being used in the certificate operation.

cancellation_requested.description: Indicates if cancellation was requested on the certificate operation.

status_details.description: The status details of the certificate operation.

error.description: Error encountered, if any, during the certificate operation.

target.description: Location which contains the result of the certificate operation.

CertificateOperation.description: A certificate operation is returned in case of asynchronous requests.

key_props.description: Properties of the key backing a certificate.

secret_props.description: Properties of the secret backing a certificate.

x509_props.description: Properties of the X509 component of a certificate.

lifetime_actions.description: Actions that will be performed by Key Vault over the lifetime of a certificate.

issuer.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

exportable.description: Indicates if the private key can be exported.

key_size.description: The key size in bytes. For example;  1024 or 2048.

reuse_key.description: Indicates if the same key pair will be used on certificate renewal.

KeyProperties.description: Properties of the key pair backing a certificate.

SecretProperties.description: Properties of the key backing a certificate.

subject.description: The subject name. Should be a valid X509 distinguished Name.

validity_months.description: The duration that the ceritifcate is valid in months.

X509CertificateProperties.description: Properties of the X509 component of a certificate.

name.description: Name of the referenced issuer object or reserved names; for example, 'Self' or 'Unknown'.

cty.description: Type of certificate to be requested from the issuer provider.

IssuerParameters.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

trigger.description: The condition that will execute the action.

action.description: The action that will be executed.

LifetimeAction.description: Action and its trigger that will be performed by Key Vault over the lifetime of a certificate.

Action.description: The action that will be executed.

lifetime_percentage.description: Percentage of lifetime at which to trigger. Value should be between 1 and 99.

Trigger.description: A condition to be satisfied for an action to be executed.

SubjectAlternativeNames.description: The subject alternate names of a X509 object.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used for the issuer.

org_details.description: Details of the organization as provided to the issuer.

IssuerBundle.description: The issuer for Key Vault certificate.

enabled.description: Determines whether the issuer is enabled.

IssuerAttributes.description: The attributes of an issuer managed by the Key Vault service.

IssuerCredentials.description: The credentials to be used for the certificate issuer.

OrganizationDetails.description: Details of the organization of the certificate issuer.

AdministratorDetails.description: Details of the organization administrator of the certificate issuer.

contacts.description: The contact list for the vault certificates.

Contacts.description: The contacts for the vault certificates.

Contact.description: The contact information for the vault certificates.

kty.description: The type of key to create. For valid key types, see JsonWebKeyType. Supported JsonWebKey key types (kty) for Elliptic Curve, RSA, HSM, Octet

key_size.description: The key size in bytes. For example, 1024 or 2048.

items.description: JSON web key operations. For more information, see JsonWebKeyOperation.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

Hsm.description: Whether to import as a hardware key (HSM) or software key.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

alg.description: The signing/verification algorithm identifier. For more information on possible algorithm types, see JsonWebKeySignatureAlgorithm.
The signing/verification algorithm. For more information on possible algorithm types, see JsonWebKeySignatureAlgorithm.

key_ops.description: Json web key operations. For more information on possible key operations, see JsonWebKeyOperation.

tags.description: Application specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

value.description: The backup blob associated with a key bundle.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

value.description: Base64 encoded representation of the certificate object to import. This certificate needs to contain the private key.

pwd.description: If the private key in base64EncodedCertificate is encrypted, the password used for encryption.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

policy.description: The management policy for the certificate.

x5c.description: The certificate or the certificate chain to merge.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used for the issuer.

org_details.description: Details of the organization as provided to the issuer.

credentials.description: The credentials to be used for the issuer.

cancellation_requested.description: Indicates if cancellation was requested on the certificate operation.

value.description: True if the signature is verified, otherwise false.
A response message containing a list of keys in the key vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of keys.

value.description: A response message containing a list of deleted keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted keys

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted keys.

DeletedKeyListResult.description: A list of keys that have been deleted in this vault.

value.description: A response message containing a list of secrets in the key vault along with a link to the next page of secrets.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of secrets.

value.description: A response message containing a list of the deleted secrets in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted secrets

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted secrets.

value.description: A response message containing a list of certificates in the key vault along with a link to the next page of certificates.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of certificates.

value.description: A response message containing a list of deleted certificates in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted certificates

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of deleted certificates.

DeletedCertificateListResult.description: A list of certificates that have been deleted in this vault.

value.description: A response message containing a list of certificate issuers in the key vault along with a link to the next page of certificate issuers.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of certificate issuers.

value.description: The backup blob containing the backed up key.

BackupKeyResult.description: The backup key result, containing the backup blob.

value.description: The backup blob containing the backed up secret.

BackupSecretResult.description: The backup secret result, containing the backup blob.

value.description: The pending certificate signing request as Base64 encoded string.

PendingCertificateSigningRequestResult.description: The pending certificate signing request result.

autoRegenerateKey.description: Determines whether keyvault should manage the storage account.

regenerationPeriod.description: The key regeneration time duration specified in ISO-8601 format.

autoRegenerateKey.description: Determines whether keyvault should manage the storage account for user.
